readings: Michael Porter, 'What is Strategy?' Harvard Business Review, Nov.-Dec. 1996, pp. 61-78.

topics: Develop Mission & Vision, Business Case Analysis
readings: Collis, 'Can You Say What Your Strategy Is?' Harvard Business Review, 2008.
Govindarajan, V., 'The Timeless Value of Unrealistic Goals,' HBR.org, October 2012.
assignments: Select Company for Strategy Business Case Project

topics: Analysis of the business landscape, the industry, its life cycle stage, the competitive environment, the strategic groups within an industry, competitor analysis, Porter’s Five Forces, and PEST analysis.
readings: Kahneman, D., Lovallo D., and Sibony O., 'Before You Make That Big Decision,' Harvard Business Review, June 2011.
F. Suarez and G. Lanzolla, 'Half Truth of First Mover Advantage,' Harvard Business Review, April 2005, Pgs. 121-127.
G. Gavetti and J. Rivkin, 'How Strategists Really Think,' Harvard Business Review, April 2005, Pgs. 54-63.
Moore, Geoffrey, 'Crossing the Chasm' (book summary).

topics: Analysis of the company’s opportunities for growth and increased profit and threats to existing businesses.
readings: David J. Collis and Cynthia A. Montgomery, 'Competing on Resources,' Harvard Business Review, July-August 2008.
Prahalad, C.K. and Hamel, G., 'The Core Competence of the Corporation,' Harvard Business Review, July-August 1990.

topics: Efficiency, Innovation, Quality, and Customer Responsiveness
readings: Sawnhey M. and Khosla S., 'Where To Look For Insight,' Harvard Business Review, November 2014.
Clayton Christensen, (Stephen Wunker and George Pohle) 'Built for Innovation,' Forbes Magazine, November 12, 2007.
Kathleen Eisenhardt and Donald Sull, 'Strategy as Simple Rules', Harvard Business Review, January 2001.
Kim, W., et al., 'Blue Ocean Strategy,' Harvard Business Review, October 2004.
Thomas Eisenmann et al., 'Strategies for Two-Sided Markets,' Harvard Business Review, October 2006.
Marshall W. Van Alstyne et al., 'Pipelines, Platforms and the New Rules of Strategy,' Harvard Business Review, April 2016.
Reeves, Martin, et al., 'Your Strategy Needs A Strategy,' HBR, September 2012.
Kim, W., et.al., 'The Benefits of Innovation That Isn’t Disruptive', Harvard Business Review, March 11, 2024.

topics: What strategies are employed in multi-business companies?
readings: Porter, 'From Competitive Advantage to Corporate Strategy,' Harvard Business Review, May-June 1987.
Cullinan, LeRoux, and Weddigen, 'When to Walk Away From A Deal,' Harvard Business Review, April 2004.

topics: What happens when industries change because of new technology, regulations, industry ecosystem or changes in customers’ tastes and needs?
readings: Clayton Christensen, 'What is Disruptive Innovation?' Harvard Business Review, December 2015.
Charles Gilbert, 'Disruptive Change: When Trying Harder is Part of the Problem,' Harvard Business Review, May 2002.
Donald Sull, 'What Makes Good Companies Go Bad?' Harvard Business Review.
Avoiding Innovation’s Terrible Toll, WSJ, January 7, 2012.

topics: How does organizational structure affect strategy?
readings: Norton and Kaplan, 'Putting the Balanced Scorecard to Work,' Harvard Business Review, Sept.-Oct. 1993.
'How the Mighty Fall,' WSJ Book Summary, Jim Collins.
Ghemawat, Pankaj, 'Managing Differences: The Central Challenge of Global Strategy,' Harvard Business Review, March 2007.

grading.policies: Grades will be based on the following: Individual Assignments, Final Exam, Class Participation, Team Assignments (HBS Cases, Strategy Business Case).

assignments.description: Journal Article Reviews - Summarize key points of assigned journal articles and post the review on Canvas.
HBS Cases - Teams will prepare case analyses of 5 Harvard Business Cases.
Strategy Business Case - Project defining a change in strategic direction and accompanying strategic initiatives for a selected company.

policies.attendance: Attendance at online sessions is recommended but not mandatory. Students unable to attend should view the recording.
policies.late_work: Late assignments will be accepted only if discussed with the instructor in advance. Point deductions will be assessed for late submissions.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit concerning their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

important_dates: May 20 – Start of Semester, First ZOOM Session

additional_info.course_format: Each week begins with an online ZOOM session on Monday at 6:30 PM EST.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Students should submit assignments to the Assignment Section of Canvas.
additional_info.support_resources: Students may wish to subscribe to strategy-related websites for periodic articles.

_metadata.course_description: This course presents models and ideas that can be used to improve decision-making in strategic management.
learning_outcomes: Acquire conceptual models and tools to dissect a firm.
Diagnose problems and evaluate a firm’s long-term prospects.
Identify viable initiatives that enhance a firm’s economic value.
Refined ability to present evidence and conclusions.
